model_answer:
The correct answer is B: Because the generator is charging the system and raises the indicated oil pressure without oil movement.
When the generator is operating, it produces electrical power which is then used to charge the aircraft's systems, including the oil pressure indicator. This causes the oil pressure gauge to show a higher reading even if the engine is not turning because there is no actual oil flow through the system. The oil pressure will return to normal once the engine starts and begins producing its own oil pressure.

The correct answer is A: To show that the magneto positions (off, left, right, both) function the same way. The presenter is making a comparison between the magneto selector on a DC-3 and the ignition controls on a Cessna 172 to help explain the layout and function of the avionics master switch.
